intro: Vrydagzynea truncicola, commonly known as the Cape fennel, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic, compound leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its small, yellow flowers are arranged in umbels, a common feature among members of its family. Vrydagzynea truncicola is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
